title: High-Resolution Volume Electron Microscopy of an Entire Epidermal Plant Cell Using Plasma-Focused Ion Beam Scanning Electron Microscopy
content: Many challenges are faced when preparing and imaging plant specimens using volume electron microscopy (vEM), including barriers inherent to plant physiology due to large vacuoles, airs spaces, waxy cuticle and cell walls [1]. Improved protocols for enhanced membrane and cell contrast as well as sample conductivity in conventional [2] and cryo-fixed [3] plant samples have enabled reliable imaging of the cell sub-structure of entire single plant cells and/or large tissue areas at sub-10nm voxel size. Such improvements supported our near-term goal to quantify and understand the distribution of a variety of unique nanoscopic plant cell features such as plasmodesmata, grana, mitochondria, plastoglobuli and the cell wall under various, developmental, biotic and abiotic experimental conditions.
